attributes.action: Abandon the plan to increase the standard school day to eight hours long.
attributes.background: George Osborne recently announced his plan to help increase a standard school day to being eight hours long. This is simply ludicrous. As a current student, I can say that the additional time will not be useful. Students want to spend as little time in school as possible. This is not what we want.
attributes.additional_details:
Towards the end of a school day as it is, there is a lack of concentration from students.

The Chancellor says that his plan is to enable us to have the best future possible. He's wrong. The longer the school day, the more problems there are.There will be more reports of bullying, leading to lower grades, stress, anxiety, depression, and even suicide.

attributes.action: Force Mr.Cameron to stick to his promises to increase spending on mental health
attributes.background: Mental illness is an illness like any other. Yet cuts to resources are continuously being made, and those who need help, cannot always find it, living a life of seclusion and loneliness. You can see a broken arm or leg, but you cannot see a broken mind, often leading to despair.
attributes.additional_details: It is estimated 1 in 4 people in Britain suffer from, or have suffered from some form of Mental illness. There is a lot of Stigma attached to this distressing condition, many do not seek help because of the risk of verbal or physical abuse, and live a life of seclusion, often resulting in suicide. Those who seek help, cannot find it as there is nowhere to go, GP's are not trained in this field, and cannot make a diagnosis or know what to prescribe. Mental Health resources must be increased.

attributes.action: Mandatory vision and reaction check-up for all 75+ with a UK Driving license.
attributes.background: I have had personal experience of elderly drivers on wrong side of the road, being oblivious to cyclists, pulling out on roundabouts not noticing vehicles, stopping in main roads and causing serious collisions due to poor sight and reactions.
attributes.additional_details:
1 in 5 over 75 year olds in the UK are suffering with vision loss; and from research I have found there are approximately 4 Million drivers over the age of 70 on UK roads.

The current system in place allows the individual to self-assess and to alert the DVLA if they are not fit to drive. In many cases if the individual needs the car for transport they will be reluctant to inform of any changes in health, vision etc. Completing a fast assessment will eliminate any possibility of this.

attributes.action: Increase standard benefit amount for ESA, & improve screening process for PIP.
attributes.background:
Thousands of people are too scared to apply for benefits, due to fear of losing current benefits or being taken to court 

The amount for ESA is £57 per week. PIP is awarded if you qualify at a testing centre, where 'not looking tired enough' will get your application declined.
attributes.additional_details:
I am part of a fibromyalgia support page, and a bipolar support page. Both of these pages are full of people who are applying for PIP and ESA, and being turned down due to 'not looking tired enough' (fibromyalgia sufferer), 'being able to be woken up by strangers at their stop on a bus' (narcolepsy sufferer), 'being mobile' when the person has to use an electric wheelchair paid for by themselves due to benefit refusal (fibromyalgia sufferer) 

Austerity is being applied in the wrong places.

attributes.action: stop charging staff and service users parking at Southmead hospital in Bristol.
attributes.background: Currently cost a full time worker £300 minimum  a year for a parking permit yet there is not enough spaces. Service users are also charged for Parking.

attributes.action: To provide free access to swimming pools and lessons to anyone under 18 yrs old.
attributes.background: After the tragic deaths in Aug 2016 please sign my petition asking for FREE access to swimming pools & swimming lessons to anyone under the age of 18 in the UK. Around 40% of children cannot properly swim & over 400 people drown in the UK every year. There is an easy way to reduce these figures.
attributes.additional_details: I am a keen pool, sea and river swimmer who feels shocked each and every time I hear of another life lost in the beautiful waters this country has in abundance. I never again want to hear a report of someone dying trying to save another human being or rescue a pet. I strongly believe that there can only be benefits to a nationwide swimming policy that improves health and encourages the use and support of local facilities.

attributes.action: Make all technical sporting goods in the UK tax free to encourage participation
attributes.background: Cycling has increased in popularity immensely since the success of the 2012 Olympics and due to the Government's cycle to work scheme allowing tax free purchasing of cycle equipment. I would like to see all technical sporting goods to be tax free to encourage more people to take up sport in the UK.
attributes.additional_details: The Olympic success in 2012 and 2016 has shown that the UK has the ability to be a great sporting nation. We should encourage more sporting participation and a healthier lifestyle by allowing tax free purchases on all technical sporting goods and not just for those in full time employment. Clothing would be exempt but hardware would be tax free. E.G bicycles, helmets, running trainers, weight training equipment, trekking poles, climbing equipment etc anything which encourages sporting activity.

attributes.action: Bring back public information films showing the dangers HGV drivers face
attributes.background: HGV drivers are constantly put in danger due to the way that other road users behave toward us when a car joins a motorway or pulls out into the line of on coming HGVs and explaining safe distances
attributes.additional_details: Increasing dash cam footage found on most online forums within the industry

attributes.action: Review family courts and cafcass mode of operation and predjudicial views.
attributes.background: A request that a Parliamentary commitee be set up to review the way family courts are conducted, the basis of evidence that they and cafcass depend on to make decisions, and the way family courts and CAFCASS are biased towards the mothers wishes over the fathers, more importantly the childs needs.
attributes.additional_details:
It is widely viewed amongst society that fathers are heavily penalised in child contact cases, and that all support is heavily biased towards mothers. 

Many fathers are wrongfully accused and a scan of mothers forums show evidence of collaboration in what accusations to make to prevent/limit contact. CAFCASS are complicit in these activities and their case workers highly prejudiced. Mothers are not held accountable for falsifying accusations.

attributes.action: Ensure disabled people are not treated less favourably when winning sport events
attributes.background: The equalities aft is clear there should be no discrimination against people who have a disability ..prise money should be equal to all people irrespective of whether they are disabled or not ..

attributes.action: Change the legislation, so that Non Binary people are recognised under the law
attributes.background: Currently, the only genders recognised under the law are 'Male' and 'Female'. This makes people who do not identify as either gender uncomfortable and is discrimative. Please change this legislation.
attributes.additional_details: It has emerged, in the recent report, allowing Transgender people to change their gender, on their passport, without a medical certificate. This is a big step, but there's much further to go. The 'X' box gender should be allowed, and therefore this legislation should be changed, recognising all gender identities, be that to one, all or no genders. Everyone is valid and deserves to be represented.

attributes.action: Make accusing someone of been a racist without hard evidence a criminal offence.
attributes.background: In light of the recent EU referendum decision and increase in reports of hate crimes, a lot of innocent, decent and hardworking people like myself have been victims of accusations suggesting (with no proof or evidence to support their claims) that people who voted to leave the EU are somehow racist.
attributes.additional_details:
Branding someone as racist without any categorical evidence what so ever also seems to be a tactic that is becoming more of a problem in political and also everyday situations. 

Certain demographics of people are using this tactic to persecute other demographics of people in order to silence their personal views or beliefs to further their own personal or political agendas.

Been racist is a disgusting crime and been wrongly accused with no evidence can be permanently damaging to peoples lives.

attributes.action: Prior to invoking Article 50 UK Gov should renegotiate EU reform & hold 2nd Ref
attributes.background: The UK Gov to work alongside EU Gov's & the EU Comm to Reform EU Treaties prior to invoking Article 50 and then put a second IN/OUT Referendum to the UK electorate on the basis of delivering material change since the 1st Referendum. This is the pragmatic way forward and will keep the Union intact.
attributes.additional_details: It is clear that the UK OUT vote has sent shock waves across Europe and that the Euro Politicians are now coming to terms that they will need to be open to renegotiation and reform whereas previously they were complacent & intransient particularly as they face similar Eurosceptism and calls for similar IN/OUT referendums from their own electorate as things stand. It is time for Europe to reform and it is time for the UK to lead these discussions now that the European elite are in listening mode.

attributes.action: Protect our marine and terrestrial environment after brexit
attributes.background: The UK was bound under EU law to protect the marine and terrestrial environment, this could be threatened due to the referendum. The Water Framework Directive, Habitat Directive, Marine Litter Directive and Bird Directive, all protected these environments. It is important we still follow these.
attributes.additional_details:
These Directives actively reduce pollution, monitor it and help reduce. At the same time it protects wildlife, it would be a backward step for the UK not to monitor and actively take part in these directives. The environment is something we should all treasure and it does not respect boundaries as we do. We must work with the EU to make this work even though we have voted out. 
It is important that fishing quotas remain to protect the future of our fish and seas, or soon there will be no fish.

attributes.action: Implement 3 month cooling off period for the EU referendum
attributes.background: We call upon the UK Government and Opposition parties to implement a cooling off period for the EU referendum so that a second ballot is required 3 months from now to verify the publics intent to leave once they have understood some of the actual implications of the UK leaving the EU.
attributes.additional_details: There were many claims and counter claims made during the EU referendum and a heated and heady level of debate. The decision is a crucial one for our country and can't be taken lightly. Over the coming 3 months more data and evidence of the implications (positive and negative) will become clearer as discussions are had and ideas explored. The decision is so momentous that we believe the public should be asked to confirm their decision to leave after a 3 month cooling off period.

attributes.action: Ban children under the age of 12 being sold sugary or high sugar content drinks
attributes.background:
Sugary drinks are proven to cause numerous health issues and have a high risk factor to health. Children should not be able to buy sugary drinks and should only be purchased with a parent or adult.
Children are not educated on health and this may promote healthy living through a ban.
attributes.additional_details:
The government do not do enough to educate children to the risk factors or unhealthy food and drink choices. Sugary drinks are the leading contributing factors to poor health in children and adults. 
Sugary drinks cause many health issues such as, Cancers, Diabetes, heart disease, dental issues, mood swings, hormonal imbalances, high blood pressure, acne, skin conditions and being obese or overweight.

attributes.action: End the compulsory licence fee for those who do not use BBC services.
attributes.background: BBC channels are always included in media packages for television viewing whether paid versions or freeview versions. This then results in the compulsory purchase of a TV licence as the 'choice' to not use these services is removed.
attributes.additional_details: This is a petition is to end compulsory inclusion of BBC services in media packages and to therefore remove or vastly reduce the licence fee for those who do not choose to use the BBC services. We should not have to pay for services not required just because we have media viewing devices in our homes.

attributes.action: Provide Funding To Re-generate & re-open the Sankey Canal and its Locks
attributes.background: The sankey canal has long fell into disrepair, I put it to Rt Hon David Cameron PM & the government to provide additional funding to canals & river trust and st helens local authority to regenerate the first modern canal in england and also of the industrial age.
attributes.additional_details: The Sankey Canal was originally known as the Sankey Brook Navigation and later as the St Helens Canal. It lays claim to being the first modern canal in England, or the first canal of the industrial age, and indeed it opened before its more famous neighbour, the Bridgewater Canal.

attributes.action: Insert gay rights as part of the school curriculum.
attributes.background: We need a policy that develops a curriculum for children and young people that supports the democratic values of a diverse Britain – including LGBT equality. There are lesbians, gays, bi and trans people in all of our school communities as teachers, support staff, students, parents and governors.
attributes.additional_details: 'Gay' remains the most frequently used term of abuse in UK schools.

attributes.action: Get the government to invest more money in mental health to lower waiting times.
attributes.background: Currently the wait to receive mental health treatment for mental illness is approximately 56 weeks (or more), without interim support, where people are now in & out of the crisis team at A&E more & more. Funding needs to increase & the waiting times need to come down before people turn to suicide!
attributes.additional_details:
1 in 4 people at some time in their life will be diagnosed with a mental health issue. However, 75% of those 1 in 4 will be left in the system for over a year to struggle on their own without access to interim support.

http://www.mind.org.uk/information-support/types-of-mental-health-problems/statistics-and-facts-about-mental-health/how-common-are-mental-health-problems/

attributes.action: Allow aged relatives outside the EU border to enter the UK via Visa application.
attributes.background: My Mother, 65, is currently living in Asia dependent on previous savings, and is unable to look after herself. Moreover, there is no one to take care of her as no close relations live with her; she is on her own. After admitting several Visa applications, the final reply was NO.
attributes.additional_details:
I want to invite my Mother so that I can take care of her personally in her late years. Furthermore, I want her to enhance the cultural views in the household and to provide that cultural upbringing to my children.

Sign this petition to take a further step onto battling such visa refusals that have no right of appeal; making the Human Right Act a mere privilege.

attributes.action: Make Southeastern performance data public to confirm 'tough targets' enforcement
attributes.background:
In Sep 2014, Southeastern were awarded 4 more years & we were promised 'tough targets'/'transparency' by Rail Minister Claire Perry
We call on MP Perry to lift the restriction on sharing target results under FOI so rail users can see the results vs targets

Full info at http://serailaction.uk
attributes.additional_details:
Southeastern Railway Action Group filed an FOI request to see performance data submitted by Southeastern to see how they performed against the "tough targets"

The Department for Transport denied this under commercial & public interest reasons.

Full details at: http://serailaction.uk/2016-03-25-Southeastern-performance-FOI-response.html

Since the DfT/MP Perry assured us that "tough targets" would be in place, while rail users see a constant decline we want to see this data & what has been done

attributes.action: EU citizens working & living in the UK for 10 years should earn full suffrage
attributes.background:
Many of us have lived & worked in the UK for most of our adult lives. Some of us have studied here too. We feel British: our families, our friends are British. This is our nation and we form the British society.
British-borns earn full suffrage at 18. Commonwealth citizenships can vote straightaway
attributes.additional_details: When you are a European citizen who has been working and living in the UK for 18 years - had I been born here I could vote in General Elections. Someone whose home is in Britain - whose family & friends are British. Someone who works hard and looks after her 'home': her street, her neighbourhood, her village, her town, her city, her region, her country. However, your 'country' does not allow you to look after it. You cannot choose a Prime Minister because you are not allowed full suffrage.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for a persons next of kin to overrule a donor card.
attributes.background: At the moment a persons next of kin can refuse to donate your organs even if you have registered yourself as an organ donor. This is unfair, the whole point of registering yourself means you wish to donate and next of kin should not be able to go against this.

attributes.action: Make the Scottish Government responsible for Scottish immigration policy
attributes.background:
Scotland must develop and enact its own policy on non-EU migration. This may also enable Scotland to determine its own migration relationship with the EU.

The Scotland Act 1998 must be amended with an act of Parliament. Scottish Government must then create a responsible ministerial department.
attributes.additional_details:
The immigration needs of Scotland are different to the demands of England. Enforcing the same immigration policy in both countries is illogical.

It will help Scotland's slow economic and population growth, and also some Tier 2 skilled workers who will otherwise be forced to leave the UK by the £35k settlement threshold. Tier 2 workers unwanted by England will have the option to live, and be valued, in a nearby nation, where they can visit their loved ones regularly.

attributes.action: Stop the sale and import of dyed fish in the UK. It is cruel and unnecessary
attributes.background: Stop the sale and import of dyed fish. Fish are beautiful in their own right. Injecting them with dye is cruel and unnecessary. It is illegal to dye them yourself in the UK but not to import them. The fish suffer and it shortens their life span.

attributes.action: Make age appropriate basic life support mandatory in the national curriculum.
attributes.background:
Give all children a chance to be life savers with age appropriate basic life support mandatory in the national curriculum in every school year.
Starting with getting help, calling 999, and going on to Asthma, Anaphylaxis, AEDs, CPR, Choking, and more.
attributes.additional_details: AEDs are automated external defibrillators, safe to use and already found in many published places such as train stations and malls.

attributes.action: Erect a statue of Nigel Farage in the Parliament for UK Independance Day.
attributes.background: Nigel Farage dedicated his life to Britain's freedom. The exit from EU was only possible thanks to his decades long struggle against EU bureaucracy and him raising awareness. As a way to celebrate the man and his accomplishments we would like to erect a statue of himself in the Members' Lobby.

attributes.action: All British expats in EU should have the Right To Vote in a Second Referendum
attributes.background: It is not democratic to vote on whether to leave or stay in the EU if British Citizens living in EU countries for longer than 15 years do not have the right to vote. We still have British Citizenship and Passports, and therefore should not be excluded.

attributes.action: Give all UK citizens living in the EU a vote concerning UK membership of it.
attributes.background: We, the long-term British residents of EU countries, will shortly lose our status as EU citizens, seriously compromising our continued stay in our host countries.  We have had no say in the referendum process, having lost the right to vote. We ask as UK citizens to add our votes to the referendum.

attributes.action: Allow children to vote after passing quiz which proves understanding of politics
attributes.background: We believe that children should have the right to vote if they can demonstrate their understanding and interest in politics by passing a quiz. We think it is unfair that citizens are given the right to vote solely based on their age, when some children have a better understanding than some adults.
attributes.additional_details: Children will have to live with the ramifications of political decisions longer than any of the voting population. Some, not all, children are very passionate about current issues and have relevant ideas and perspectives to share. We believe it would be irresponsible to allow all children the vote, as many have little to no understanding or appreciation of politics. However, we argue that age is not a fair classification in determining one's right to create change.

attributes.action: Give citizens of the UK the ability to initiate their own nation-wide referenda.
attributes.background: After an appropriate sized petition is raised, of maybe 400,000 people, a nation-wide referendum is called to annul any act of parliament, law or treaty in effect within the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
The word democracy stems from the Greek word, dēmokratía, comprising two parts: dêmos "people" and kratos "power". Without a demos, there is no democracy. But people without power is not democracy either.

Our current system of government is known as "representative democracy". That phrase is a misuse of the word democracy. People do not hold power: that system cannot by definition be a democracy.

attributes.action: Make it so someone working 40 hours on minimum wage dont pay tax on earnings
attributes.background: I believe that if the government is saying that a person needs to earn a set amount every hour to survive it is then wrong of them to take money off you in taxes from your earnings.
attributes.additional_details:
I think that if someone was earning minimum wage at £7.20 an hour and worked 39 hours a week for a full 52 weeks they would earn £14601.60
I believe that as a government you should make it into law that you can not be taxed on your earnings if you earn less then the minimum wage yearly total.

attributes.action: Force food outlets to display a Capital H sign if they use Halal meat.
attributes.background:
Many food outlets are using and selling us Halal meat without our knowledge.
This meat has come from the barbaric practice of slitting the the animals throat without stunning them first. They are hung upside down and left to bleed to death. You deserve the right to know what you are eating.
attributes.additional_details: You should be able to clearly see if a food outlet is using Halal meat. You should be able to make an educated choice before buying.

attributes.action: Replace all Benefits with a Universal Guaranteed Minimum Income
attributes.background: Guaranteed minimum income means the provision of identical payments from a government to all of its citizens, that is unconditionally granted to all on an individual basis, without means test or work requirement.
attributes.additional_details:
A basic income will provide a more substantial safety net for all people. and will contribute to less working hours, better working conditions and a better distribution of jobs. 

It is a means for sharing out the wealth produced by a society to all people. 

It can help people do other work and reconsider old choices.

It rewards unpaid contributions to society that our economy increasingly relies on. 

And is a way to redistribute the advantages of on-going technological advancement.

attributes.action: Exteremly poor service, revoke Govia Ltd's franchise of Great Northern Railways
attributes.background: GNR are continuously running a bad service. They have ongoing late running trains and often cancel services due to lack of staff and broken trains. They have not invested in new rolling stock and the trains are constantly dirty, seats are broken and trains break down.

attributes.action: Establish and fund a national Hate Crime Task Force.
attributes.background: Parliament should form and fund a national hate crime task force to tackle the unprecedented rise in hate related crime and incidents against minority groups, since the vote to leave the EU. Police and the Judiciary should be provided all necessary resources to investigate and prosecute offences.
attributes.additional_details: Leave or Remain - Not in our name. We have seen a startling rise in both reported and unreported acts of hatred and violence towards sections of our communities "identified" by offenders as "Non-British". Whilst millions of British people may have voted to leave the EU, they do not, and would never, condone this behaviour. We all, and our government has an irrefutable responsibility to challenge and prevent these deplorable acts, with all the force of the law.

attributes.action: Change all current motorcycle licensing laws.
attributes.background: The current Motorcycle licensing laws are dangerous for young riders and deter them from progressing to a higher licence. The 28MPH limit on 50cc's is extremely dangerous especially on duel carriageways. The A1 licence should be 250/300cc for motorway use, 125cc's are treacherous for motorway use.
attributes.additional_details:
Things that need to change:
1-	Remove the 28MPH limit on 50cc scooters, they are very dangerous. Most people de-restrict them anyway.
2-	Change the following classes 125cc Lerner rider; 250/300cc A1 rider; 600+cc A unrestricted rider
3-	Allow A1 upgrade system after 2 years of holding the A1 license.
4-	Change CBT to include some theory
5-	Lower the cost of tests as failing is up to £75 down the drain
6-	Make more test times available for around 5PM to 7PM Mon to fri and weekends if possible.

attributes.action: To review all UK bridge height signs to avoid bridge strikes and protect drivers
attributes.background: Avoidable Bridge Strikes are putting HGV/PSV drivers lives and livelihoods and that of their passengers and employers at risk every day, retrospective investigations of bridge strikes by TfL identified 3 Network Rail bridges in London displaying signage that overstated the height of the bridge.
attributes.additional_details: Failing to take the opportunity to investigate UK bridge heights in light of the evidence produced by Transport for London is tantamount to turning a blind eye to the health and safety of HGV/PSV/Network Rail drivers and any member of the general public unfortunate to be involved. The UK Government must implement an “Immediate nationwide pro-active investigation of all bridges under 5.03m”. Waiting or hoping vehicles will not strike a bridge is placing lives at risk, plain and simple.

attributes.action: Create a law preventing the independence of any part of the United Kingdom
attributes.background: After Britain has voted to Leave the European Union, we are faced with the possible break of the UK's union. We must stop this. The UK can stand on its two feet, but cannot if it is split. London, Northern Ireland and Scotland may possibly leave the UK. Let's stop this by signing this petition.

attributes.action: Ban Smoking Except in Designated Areas
attributes.background:
There has been lots of scientific research done on passive smoking. It shows that passive smoking is just as bad as actually smoking. When someone is smoking nearby you're breathing in their smoke as well. 
Therefore smoking should be banned outside as well as inside except in designated areas.

attributes.action: Reform section 127, Communications Act & Section 1, Malicious Communications Act
attributes.background:
Signatories of this petition ask the Government to remove any reference of the following from section 127, Communications Act & Section 1, Malicious Communications Act

“Grossly offensive” , “Indecent”, “obscene” , “Causing annoyance”, “inconvenience”,  and “needless anxiety”.
attributes.additional_details:
A number of cases have made it to the national press of people being arrested for “Grossly offensive” jokes and comments on twitter and FB. Section 127 and Section 1 both have wording that is extremely vague and ambiguous. Both acts can be read here:

http://www.legislation.gov.uk/ukpga/2003/21/section/127
http://www.legislation.gov.uk/ukpga/1988/27/section/1

Free expression is the corner stone of a free democracy. Reform these laws to remove ambiguity and respect that vital human right.

attributes.action: Hold a referendum to implement a Universal Basic Income scheme in the UK.
attributes.background:
Instead of running an expensive mean tested benefits system; instead pay adult in the UK a Basic living income to end poverty within the UK.

This will reduce the cost of administering the welfare state.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for schools to lock toilets during lesson times and break times
attributes.background: My daughters and other children at school are forced to wait up to 20 minutes for someone to come and unlock the school toilets - this is not right. There are children with bladder difficulties and girls who need toilet access. Do you think it's appropriate to have them locked? I certainly do not.

attributes.action: Keep spending a fixed 0.7 per cent slice of our national wealth on Foreign Aid
attributes.background: A popular petition wants to end our committment: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/125692 . This is totally wrong. As a country, we committed to giving 0.7% of our GDP to help countries which are in far direr straits than we are. Charity starts at home, but we must help others too.
attributes.additional_details:
People often protest that it all goes to corrupt officials, but the solution is not to spend less, but to spend smarter. We must keep giving for those who do use the money wisely.

A way to improve the effectiveness of foreign aid could be to end the requirement for countries to subscribe to free trade deals when they receive certain forms of it (as economist Ha-Joon Chang argues).

This webpage counters many myths about foreign aid: https://www.givingwhatwecan.org/get-involved/myths-about-aid/

attributes.action: Enforce minimum wage calculation to be changed to help commission based workers.
attributes.background: For many years now National Minimum wage has been calculated and includes commission based jobs, so to calculate how your minimum wage is made up, your commissions will be topping your salary up to make up the short fall, this in some commissioned based jobs can be a short fall of £600 or more.
attributes.additional_details:
The National Minimum wage and the new National Living wage keeps getting increased and the government are leaving commissions in the calculations so the short fall is increasing.
Employers are abusing the loop hole by not paying national minimum wage and relying on their employees to make up the short fall with commissions.
THE SOLUTION
There should at least be a National Minimum Salary enforced to overcome this, this should equate to the amount of hours you work at the National Minimum wage.

attributes.action: The British government should refer to Israel as “Apartheid Israel”
attributes.background: The UK government should use as frequently as possible the terminology “Apartheid Israel” rather than just Israel because South African anti-Apartheid icons like Desmond Tutu have confirmed that Israel's system of brutal ethnic separation and occupation is far worse than South African Apartheid
attributes.additional_details: South African John Dugard, the former U.N. Special Rapporteur on Human Rights said: "I’m a South African who lived through Apartheid. I've no hesitation in saying that Israel’s crimes are infinitely worse than those committed by the Apartheid regime of South Africa."  Veteran Jewish anti-Apartheid activist Denis Goldberg, who was sentenced with Nelson Mandela to life in prison in the 1964 Rivonia treason trial said: "There is no doubt in my mind that Israel is an Apartheid state".

attributes.action: Urgently bring forward the planned works to the A417 missing link / Birdlip Hill
attributes.background: The A417 birdlip hill (Gloucester) is a notorious accident black spot and is gridlocked on a daily basis, which has a huge impact on commuters, businesses and visitors to the area. The planned works to improve the road much be brought forward as soon as possible to rectify this horrendous situation
attributes.additional_details: http://a417missinglink.co.uk

attributes.action: Esophageal cancer awareness day!
attributes.background:
Esophageal cancer is rare aggressive form of cancer.
People with esophageal cancer may experience the following symptoms or signs. Sometimes people with esophageal cancer do not show any of these symptoms. 
having a mandatory camera at the age of 50-55 is ideal
attributes.additional_details:
*Difficulty and pain with swallowing, particularly when eating meat, bread, or raw vegetables.
*Even liquid may be painful to swallow.
*Pressure or burning in the chest
*Indigestion or heartburn
*Vomiting
*Frequent choking on food
*Unexplained weight loss
*Coughing or hoarseness
*Pain behind the breastbone or in the throat

We need to make the endoscope camera mandatory for persistent cases, also we need to spread the word so having a national esophageal awareness day would be awesome!

attributes.action: Make it illegal for disabled toilets to be used as storage
attributes.background:
In the news 18th July 2016 eurostar were using disabled toilets for push bikes , this is not unusual in the few months I've found two pubs I'm my local area using their disabled toilet as storage for high chairs .
Disabled toilets are for easy access  not storage.
attributes.additional_details: Eurostar storing bikes in disabled toilets - http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-36820751
